Data: Cummins to Cook, no run worked towards midwicket
Cummins to Cook, no run offered some width and latches into a cut but picks out backward point
Cummins to Cook, FOUR runs lovely from Cook now, full outside off and he drives it square through the off side picking the gap perfectly. His first boundary.
Cummins to Cook, 1 run short ball this time and Cook plays a swivel-pull all along the ground through square leg
Cummins to Bell, 1 run a slower delivery which is quite short, Bell runs it down to third man
Cummins to Cook, no run another slower ball to end the over and Cook pushes to the off side
Doherty to Bell, 1 run round the wicket, very full and driven down to long-off
Doherty to Cook, 1 run stays round the wicket to Cook who pushes easily down to long-on
Doherty to Bell, 1 run easily milked down to long-off passed a diving Doherty
Doherty to Cook, no run beaten as he tries to cut
Doherty to Cook, no run comes forward and works from off stump to square leg
Doherty to Cook, no run sweeps firmly from quite wide outside off, connects well but square leg makes a good save
Watson to Bell, no run length ball, dabbed towards point
Watson to Bell, FOUR runs pitched up on the stumps and whipped smartly in front of midwicket for another sweetly timed boundary for Bell
Watson to Bell, 1 run length ball outside off, dropped short on the off side for a quick single
Watson to Cook, no run good length, sliding across Cook and leaving him a touch, draws a false stroke - but no edge
Watson to Cook, 1 run short and slightly wide, slashed behind point with a workmanlike swing of the arms
Watson to Bell, no run tight line on off, good length, defended into off side
Doherty to Cook, 1 run tossed up and swept to deep backward square
Doherty to Bell, no run flighted on the stumps, pushed into the off side coming forward
Doherty to Bell, FOUR runs full toss from Doherty and Bell had already reversed the grip, reverse paddling four through the vacant third man area - impudent stuff
Doherty to Bell, no run tossed up and driven to cover
Doherty to Bell, 1 run length ball on off, tapped short of cover for another one
Doherty to Cook, FOUR runs short and wide, Cook hangs back and slaps this behind point for four more - all looking a lot easier for the English opening pair now
Lee to Bell, no run full and outside off, driven to mid-off on the front foot
Lee to Bell, no run tight line, quite full in length again, punched towards cover
Lee to Bell, no run back of a length, Bell thinks about pulling but decides against it, ducking his head out of the way
Lee to Bell, no run short of a good length again, on the stumps, defended back down the track and Lee fields
Lee to Bell, 1 run full and wide, steered through point to the man on the boundary rope
Lee to Cook, 1 run short, on the body, nudged into the leg side
Watson to Cook, no run good length, on the line of off, pushed defensively to cover
Watson to Cook, 1 run pitched up outside off, Cook shuffles across and drives to mid-off, who misfields and they pick up one
Watson to Bell, no run touch short, on the stumps, defended
Watson to Bell, 2 runs bit of width and chopped through gully, third man comes round to cut it off
Watson to Bell, 1 run in the corridor outside off, driven through cover
Watson to Cook, 1 run pitched up on leg stump, clipped through square
Lee to Cook, no run full, almost yorker length, and Cook does well to dig it out in front of middle and off
Lee to Cook, no run pitched up and driven into the covers
Lee to Cook, FOUR runs length ball on off, driven through mid-off and George Bailey misfields in Australian-middle-order-sitcom fashion to send the ball skittering away for four
Lee to Cook, no run defended in front of the stumps
Lee to Cook, 1 run wide of the stumps and cut aerially through the gully region

Lee to Bell, OUT oh no, Bell MK II suffers a familiar glitch, hit in front of off and he has to go, no matter how attractive his 41 was! It was another testing ball from Lee, nipping back just a shade and Bell tried to drive back down the pitch, looked like a good call from
Watson to Cook, 2 runs almost two in two! Length ball down the leg side and Cook gets a faint edge on it, the ball hitting Wade's fingertips and running away
Watson to Cook, no run defended in front of the stumps
Watson to Cook, no run tight line and length, forward defensive
Watson to Cook, FOUR runs too wide this time and Cook hammers a cut shot to the rope, a familiar, thrashing blow
Watson to Cook, no run length ball outside off, no stroke
Watson to Cook, 1 run pushed through outside off, edged on to the pads and they nab one
Lee to Cook, 1 run pitched up on the legs, clipped through square
Lee to Trott, no run back of a length outside off, played towards point
Lee to Trott, 1 run length ball, seaming back a touch from outside off and deflected past leg stump via Trott's inside edge
Lee to Cook, FOUR runs short and Cook is quickly on the pull (not like that - he's a married man) to crash a boundary through square on the leg side
Lee to Cook, no run length ball on off, pushed back down the pitch
Lee to Cook, no run tight line, gets forward and pushes short of cover
Watson to Trott, no run length ball and dabbed into the off side
Watson to Trott, no run short and wide, Trott shuffles across and swipes a cut shot ... straight to point on the bounce
Watson to Trott, no run pitched up and driven towards midwicket
Watson to Trott, no run length ball outside off, Trott gets forward in lugubrious defence
Watson to Trott, 1 run full and wide of off, driven on the front foot to the cover sweeper
Watson to Cook, no run full and around off, gets forward and punched to mid-off
Cummins to Trott, no run length ball outside off, pushed into the covers
Cummins to Trott, 1 run fuller length, driven through a gap to the man at deep cover
Cummins to Cook, no run length ball outside off, lets this one through
Cummins to Cook, no run angled across and punched into the off side
Cummins to Cook, no run fullish length, outside off and driven straight to mid-off

Cummins to Cook, OUT Lord's falls quiet as Cook chases one outside off and nicks off. Cummins has his first international wicket against England (the first of many?) and Australia's bowlers are finally getting the rewards for their disciplined approach
Watson to Trott, 2 runs on the pads and nudged through square, good running garners them a couple
Watson to Trott, no run length ball, defended outside off
Watson to Trott, no run in the corridor outside off, Trott gets forward in defence
Watson to Trott, no run off-stump line, good length, tapped into the covers
Watson to Trott, no run back of a length, sticks in the pitch a touch and Trott scoops it short of mid-on trying to work the ball square
Watson to Trott, 1 run short and wide of off stump, Trott turns it round the corner for a single to square leg
Cummins to Trott, 1 run pitched up outside off, cover drive through the infield for one
Cummins to Bopara, 1 run good length ball outside off, Bopara gets forward and opens the face for one down to third man
Cummins to Trott, no run defended on the front foot outside off
Cummins to Trott, 1 run searching for that fuller length, clipped through the covers
Cummins to Bopara, no run fierce bouncer, well-directed from Cummins, hits Bopara on the helmet and neck as he turns away
Cummins to Bopara, no run good length ball on the stumps, Bopara gets forward well in defence
Doherty to Trott, no run tossed up on middle, tickled to the man at midwicket
Doherty to Trott, 1 wide flighted but drifting down leg, Trott misses out with an attempted sweep - but it was a wide
Doherty to Trott, 1 run tossed up and punched past midwicket and they put pressure on mid-on to successfully scramble one
Doherty to Bopara, no run full and pushed into the covers
Doherty to Bopara, no run tossed up outside off, Bopara opens the face and steers to short third man
Doherty to Bopara, no run bit of spin, outside off and played to cover
Doherty to Bopara, 1 run tossed up and driven to mid-on for one
Cummins to Bopara, no run back of a length and worked to midwicket pressing forward
Cummins to Bopara, 3 runs full, angling in on off stump but Bopara flicks the wrists and times the ball like a Rolex back past the bowler
Cummins to Trott, 1 run length ball, pushed through covers
Cummins to Bopara, 1 run touch full, driven through extra-cover on the front foot
Cummins to Trott, no run length ball, played into the off side
Cummins to Trott, no run Trott steps away and Cummins spies him, sending down a slower ball wide of off and the batsman is marooned, can't connect
Doherty to Bopara, no run tossed up outside off, pushed to the man at extra-cover
Doherty to Bopara, 2 runs shorter length, bit of grip and Bopara cuts fine - possibly via a thick edge - for a couple to third man
Doherty to Bopara, 1 run short again, goes back and cuts hard through point to the man on the rope
Doherty to Trott, FOUR runs full and flighted, Trott skips forward and pokes Neil Mulligan right in the eye lofts Doherty straight back down the ground for four
Doherty to Trott, no run length ball outside off, flatter delivery, tapped into the off side
Doherty to Trott, 1 run full and on leg stump, swept behind square

Cummins to Trott, 1 run would have been a run-out! Dropped into the off side and they race for a single, Cummins collected in his follow through, turned and threw at the non-striker's end which would have had Trott short
Cummins to Bopara, no run played into the leg side
Cummins to Bopara, no run beaten! Lovely delivery, full outside off stump and draws Bopara into a drive
Cummins to Bopara, 1 run whipped into the leg side from outside off, mid-on moves to his right to field
Cummins to Trott, no run and one of them is in action as Trott defends a back-of-a-length delivery
Cummins to Trott, 1 wide loses his line this time, attempted slower ball which doesn't come out right and is dragged very wide
Cummins to Trott, 1 run played late by Trott as he guides it fine of the first gully down to third man
Doherty to Trott, 1 run sweeps a very full delivery out to deep square
Doherty to Bopara, no run touch quicker, angling in towards middle and leg, defended to the off side

Doherty to Bopara, FOUR runs down the pitch and drilled through the off side, but he was nearly done in the flight as Doherty tossed it fuller and wider as he saw Bopara charge but the batsman held his nerve
Doherty to Bopara, no run popped in the air towards mid-on...right where one of the catches was previously when the quicks bowled at Bopara earlier
Doherty to Bopara, 1 run pushed into the off side
Doherty to Trott, no run pushed off the back foot into the covers
McKay to Bopara, OUT gone! Strikes first ball with a lovely delivery. Squared up Bopara on off stump and the edge flies comfortably to Michael Clarke at slip who is rewarded for still attacking
McKay to Morgan, 1 run off the mark straight away as he drives off the back foot to deep cover
McKay to Trott, no run back of a length, defended with soft hands to gully
McKay to Trott, 1 run uses his feet to McKay then drives him over cover to the man sweeping on the boundary
McKay to Morgan, no run pushed wider outside off and left alone
McKay to Morgan, no run closer to off stump but Morgan again opts not to play
Doherty to Trott, 1 run tossed up on off stump, driven past a diving cover down to long-off
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run places this square backward of point
Doherty to Trott, no run punched back towards the bowler who dives in his followthrough
Doherty to Trott, no run defended off the back foot to the leg side
Doherty to Trott, no run drives off a thick outside edge to short third man
Doherty to Trott, 1 run dragged down shorter and wider, Trott cuts out to the man in the deep...don't suspect Australia will mind Trott keeping the strike
McKay to Trott, no run pushed square into the off side
McKay to Trott, 1 run goes across his crease and works it through midwicket out to the sweeper
McKay to Morgan, no run drives and misses outside off, wasn't that full and he was aiming on the up
McKay to Morgan, 1 run on the back foot, opens the face to find the gap
McKay to Trott, 1 run a slower ball which is dragged down a touch short and Trott pulls to deep square
McKay to Morgan, 2 runs latches onto some width with a front-foot cut which he doesn't time that well and it allows Lee to tidy up from deep cover
Doherty to Trott, no run nice stuff from Doherty now, draws Trott forward and he pushes to the off side
Doherty to Trott, no run half an appeal as Trott squeezes this into the off side

Doherty to Trott, 3 runs full on leg side, beautifully whipped away through midwicket...David Hussey makes an athletic dive on the boundary and pulls off a stunning piece of fielding to prevent the boundary. Brilliant effort
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run stays round the wicket, worked off middle out to deep midwicket

Doherty to Trott, no run lovely bowling, beats Trott with one that turns quite sharply. Australia go for two appeals (stumping and catch) and Clarke then reviews for the caught behind. Hot Spot doesn't show an edge
Doherty to Trott, 1 run driven down to long-off
Watson to Trott, 1 run back of a length and turned to deep square
Watson to Morgan, no run comes across outside off and defends back to the bowler
Watson to Morgan, 1 run a full delivery which is nicely driven through the off side
Watson to Trott, 2 runs takes a straight delivery through midwicket with a tuck off his pads
Watson to Trott, no run outside off and left alone
Watson to Trott, 2 runs comes down the pitch and outside leg to give himself some room and drives through the off side...placed well enough for a brace
Doherty to Morgan, 2 runs round the wicket, worked from well outside off through midwicket and placed nicely wide of long-on
Doherty to Morgan, no run goes for the cut and misses
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run connects this time having jumped extravagantly around the crease...gets a single to deep point
Doherty to Trott, no run defended to the off side
Doherty to Trott, no run driven out to cover
Doherty to Trott, 1 run pushed off the back foot down to long off
Watson to Trott, 1 run back of a length, worked from outside off to midwicket
Watson to Morgan, 1 run picks out the gap at midwicket
Watson to Trott, 1 run aggression from Trott, again steps to leg to open up the off side and drills his shot out to the cover sweeper
Watson to Morgan, no run outside off and left alone
Watson to Morgan, no run on off stump, leans forward and defends to the off side
Watson to Morgan, no run driven off the back foot and picks out cover
Cummins to Trott, 1 run starts full outside and driven to deep cover
Cummins to Morgan, no run back of a length on off stump, defended to the covers
Cummins to Morgan, no run fuller on middle and off, worked down to mid-on
Cummins to Morgan, no run beaten for pace as he goes for a cut...perhaps wasn't as wide as Morgan thought
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run flicked in the air through midwicket but it's just a single
Cummins to Trott, no run drives square on the off side and well fielded by point...excellent over from Cummins
Lee to Morgan, FOUR runs nicely played, taken from outside off stump with a turn of the wrists. It beats mid-on and a laboured McKay can't catch it
Lee to Morgan, no run pulls the length back a little and pushed firmly to cover
Lee to Morgan, 1 run cut in the air through gully and reaches third man in a flash
Lee to Trott, 1 run a full toss outside off stump takes Trott by surprise but he ends up playing it quite well down to third man...as though he didn't pick up that delivery
Lee to Morgan, no run defended back towards the bowler
Lee to Morgan, no run ooh, he nearly chops this into the stumps but the bottom edges scoots past Wade to fine leg
Cummins to Trott, 1 run another occasion when Trott gives himself room by coming down outside leg stump but can only slice this to deep cover
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run now Morgan uses his feet too, Cummins responds by dragging the length back and it's cut to third man
Cummins to Trott, no run dropped was driven firmly back to the bowler but Cummins couldn't hold on
Cummins to Trott, FOUR runs very wide and Trott finally latches onto one with timing and placement as he dispatches it away from deep cover
Cummins to Trott, 1 run short of a length, Trott hangs on the back foot and opens the face
Cummins to Morgan, SIX runs big blow! Morgan breaks free by launching a full delivery high straight down the ground and it comfortably clears the boundary
Lee to Trott, 1 run guided down to third man

Lee to Morgan, 2 runs full and wide, driven in the air over backward point with an open face and more excellent work on the boundary, this time by Cummins, to save the boundary as he flicks it back to his team-mate
Lee to Morgan, 1 run pushed square through point
Lee to Trott, FOUR runs driven off a thick outside edge and it races fine of third man...another useful boundary, some momentum building
Lee to Trott, 2 runs angled backward of point and good running brings two to take him to another half-century, this one off 65 balls
Lee to Trott, 2 runs sweetly driven through the off side, the sweeper is square and can't cut off the second...12 off the over, to go with 13 off the previous one
Watson to Morgan, 1 run pushed into the off side
Watson to Trott, no run opens the face with soft hands into the off side but point is in quickly
Watson to Trott, 1 run full outside off and driven out to cover
Watson to Morgan, 1 wide full outside leg stump and he doesn't get away with it
Watson to Morgan, 1 run worked into the leg side, Watson chases himself and dives but can't prevent the single
Watson to Trott, 1 run down the pitch and driven out to the cover sweeper
Watson to Morgan, 2 runs cut through backward point and these two have run well together

Doherty to Trott, OUT tossed up on leg stump and bowled him! Trott simply missed with an attempted glance through the on side, almost yorking himself as the ball dipped and slipped under the bat to break the wicket
Doherty to Kieswetter, no run full and on the stumps, studied forward defensive
Doherty to Kieswetter, no run flighted around off, pushed to extra-cover
Doherty to Kieswetter, no run tight line, full and straight, driven back to the bowler
Doherty to Kieswetter, 1 run touch shorter, Kieswetter goes back and slashes hard , Smith leaps to his left at extra-cover to make a terrific stop and limit them to one
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run tossed up and across, worked from in front of off through midwicket
McKay to Morgan, 1 run touch short, pushed across as Morgan steps out and angles the ball through point for one
McKay to Kieswetter, no run length ball outside, coming back a touch, Kieswetter offers no stroke
McKay to Kieswetter, no run touch short of a good length, angled in towards the stumps, dabbed into the on side
McKay to Kieswetter, no run good length, just outside off, Kieswetter advances and attempts to mow the ball down the ground ... but fails to get ball on bat
McKay to Kieswetter, no run shorter length, stays back and defends
McKay to Kieswetter, 1 run pitched up outside off and driven square to the cover sweeper
Doherty to Kieswetter, 1 run tossed up on leg, nurdled through midwicket
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run gives it some air, outside off and Morgan goes down on one knee, doesn't quite connect with the slog-sweep and they get one to deep midwicket
Doherty to Kieswetter, 1 run full and one the stumps, straightening a touch, chipped down the ground
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run length ball, sliding across, goes back and late cuts
Doherty to Kieswetter, 1 run full and flighted on the stumps, Kieswetter drills a shot at extra-cover
Doherty to Morgan, 1 run length ball, cut behind point
McKay to Morgan, FOUR runs pitched up outside odd, Morgan narrows the gap and slams a lusty drive between mid-off and extra-cover for four, fierce stuff
McKay to Morgan, 1 run on the stumps and worked to mid-on this time
McKay to Kieswetter, 1 run back of a length, dropped into the off side for one
McKay to Morgan, 1 run full and wide, dribbled back down the ground to long-off
McKay to Kieswetter, 1 run slower ball outside off, patted through the covers
McKay to Morgan, 1 run full and tickled into the off side for another single
Cummins to Morgan, FOUR runs short and shovelled wristily over square leg, that fair flew out of the middle, dying half a yard in front of the rope

Cummins to Morgan, 2 runs bumper again and this time Morgan trampolines it towards third man with the open face of the bat, Wade makes very good ground getting across but can't quite pull off what would have been a stunning catch
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run slower ball from Cummins, fiddled off the hips into the leg side - and that's a nifty fifty for Morgan, at more than a run a ball
Cummins to Kieswetter, 1 run length outside off, driven through the covers
Cummins to Morgan, 1 run slow bouncer this time, Morgan swivels and guides it round the corner to long leg
Cummins to Kieswetter, 1 run another slower delivery, Kieswetter waits on it and dabs wide of short third man, who pulls it in but not before they get one
McKay to Kieswetter, 1 run full and straight, punched through the leg side with a flick of the wrists
McKay to Morgan, no run takes the pace off it, little bit short and wide but Morgan's flashing blade only finds the man at point
McKay to Morgan, 2 runs pitched up outside off, Morgan manufactures a drive the infield, out to wide long-on, and they scamper a couple
McKay to Morgan, 1 run pitched up outside off and drilled down the ground
McKay to Kieswetter, no run slower ball, out the back off the hand, completely befuddles Kieswetter, who misses with a pulled and the ball bounces over the stumps
McKay to Kieswetter, 2 runs another slower one, this time clubbed into a gap in front of deep midwicket, good running brings a couple
Lee to Morgan, no run full and straight, Morgan can't quite dig it out and Lee fields
Lee to Morgan, 1 run pitched up wide of the stumps, chopped through cover-point to the man in the deep
Lee to Kieswetter, 1 run another wide full-bunger from Lee, Kieswetter practically falls over bringing his bat down to squeeze the ball away square on the off side
Lee to Morgan, no run bouncer but taking the pace off it, Morgan had stepped away and is foxed, no stroke played as the ball loops past
Lee to Morgan, SIX runs full toss and this time Morgan does connect, bunting a maximum over wide long-on

Lee to Morgan, SIX runs and he goes again! This one was only fractionally overpitched but Morgan stepped out and swiped Lee back over the rope, the same part of the ground, rather undoing all the bowler's good work in that over
Watson to Kieswetter, FOUR runs and after more than a few sighters, Kieswetter follows Morgan's example by stepping away and crashing the ball back over the bowler's head
Watson to Kieswetter, 1 run full and straight, dug out towards long-off
Watson to Morgan, SIX runs length ball on middle and Morgan unleashes again, spearing the ball over the rope on the up out towards deep square leg - this is sixy hitting, all right
Watson to Morgan, 2 runs full length, skips out and lofts over mid-on, well fielded on the bounce in the deep but they steal two
Watson to Morgan, 2 runs pitched up wide of off, jams his bat down and it runs towards mid-off, the fielder on the boundary is a bit slow to react and they again hustle for two
Watson to Morgan, FOUR runs overpitched, drilled low along the surface, very fine straight back past the bowler and beats the dive of long-off
Lee to Kieswetter, 1 run pitched up outside off, Kieswetter steps out and across, thinking to slog, changes his mind and deflects the ball short on the off side
Lee to Morgan, 1 run pitched up wide of off, dragged back down the pitch for a single to long-off
Lee to Kieswetter, no run yorker-length outside off, Kieswetter again looking to free his arms and can only chop into the off side
Lee to Kieswetter, 1 run length ball outside off, slapped through the cover region
Lee to Morgan, no run round the wicket, full and wide, might have taken the pace off a bit and Morgan misses with a big old yahoo
Lee to Morgan, FOUR runs full and well wide, this time Morgan gets under it, the ball slicing away off the toe of the bat, over gully and skipping to the boundary
Watson to Kieswetter, no run full toss, whacked back at Watson and he takes a nasty blow on the fingertips
Watson to Kieswetter, FOUR runs length ball and Kieswetter turns inventor, going down on one knee to flip the ball over his head for four down to long leg
Watson to Kieswetter, 1 run pitched up outside off, drilled through the covers
Watson to Morgan, 2 runs another full toss, hoicked out towards deep midwicket, who runs around and fields on the bounce
Watson to Morgan, 1 run pitched up, angled across, chopped down to long-on
Watson to Kieswetter, OUT length ball, Kieswetter hits on the up but it goes straight up, long-off comes scampering in from the boundary and takes a well-judged diving catch

3.25pm: That wraps up the England innings, with 54 runs coming off the last five overs. Morgan provided the spark, after the solid foundations built by Cook, Bell and Trott - exactly to plan, in other words. After a searching few overs with the new balls in helpful conditions, and

Hello everyone, Australia today is it! These opponents change almost as quickly as the British weather, which now is lovely and warm with regular sunshine. Ideal conditions for the Aussies to try and chase 273 - a score that England did jolly well to get from where they were. Shou
James Anderson to open the bowling with the dangerous Shane Watson and the even more dangerous David Warner opening the batting. A bright start would be most welcome for the visitors...
Anderson to Watson, no run length around off stump and Watson forward to block
Anderson to Watson, no run almost identically delivered and identically played
Anderson to Watson, 1 run ran down to third man and the chase is underway
Anderson to Warner, no run blocked going back and across off stump
Anderson to Warner, 1 wide full down leg side
Anderson to Warner, 1 run slightly straighter and tucked through square leg
Anderson to Watson, 2 runs too straight to the right-hander now and worked through square leg
Finn to Warner, no run good length on the off stump, blocked back up the wicket
Finn to Warner, 3 runs back foot punch through extra cover, fine stroke, just hauled back by Cook at the boundary
Finn to Watson, no run blocked on the front foot around off stump
Finn to Watson, 1 run little bit of width and chopped down to third man
Finn to Warner, no run length and Warner went to play to leg and got done for pace, getting struck on the thigh pad
Finn to Warner, no run much fuller and draws Warner into the drive, he plays and misses
Anderson to Watson, 1 run length and played down to third man on the front foot, opening the face
Anderson to Warner, no run just outside off and tucked to point
Anderson to Warner, no run fine delivery, leaving Watson from a good length and beating his defensive push
Anderson to Warner, no run back of a length now and tucked to midwicket
Anderson to Warner, no run driven without foot movement and another play and miss
Anderson to Warner, no run this is closer to him and he drops it to cover
Finn to Watson, no run angled in and striking the pad
Finn to Watson, no run length and left alone outside off
Finn to Watson, no run angled in again, Watson goes to whip it away and misses, a strangled lbw appeal
Finn to Watson, no run forward to block
Finn to Watson, no run big bumper and ignored, wide? Apparently not
Finn to Watson, 1 run dropped in front of cover, Bopara comes in as they take a single and fails to gather so they get home with ease
Anderson to Watson, 1 run pulled off only a length really out to the man in the deep on the leg side
Anderson to Warner, no run length around off stump and blocked back to Anderson
Anderson to Warner, 1 run a touch too straight but only a single via midwicket
Anderson to Watson, no run length and Watson stands still and tries to angle to third man but finds gully
Anderson to Watson, 1 run very full and squeezed through square leg for one
Anderson to Warner, 1 run length played just wide enough of mid on for a sharp single
Finn to Warner, no run full on off stump, driven on the walk to mid off
Finn to Warner, 1 run pushed to cover, Bopara again...misses again when a run out was on, that was miles away
Finn to Watson, FOUR runs marvellous stroke down the ground for four, Watson is so good in taking a huge stride and then thumping the ball straight, that was a joy to watch

Finn to Watson, OUT cry for caught behind as Watson looked to back-cut, given not out and England, who were convinced, refer this, there's a noise...and a mark on Hot Spot, this is going to be out and indeed up goes the finger. Watson stood still and tried to angle the ball
Finn to Bailey, no run back of a length and blocked back up the wicket
Finn to Bailey, no run angled in and blocked back up the wicket again
Anderson to Warner, no run length outside off and this time Warner is leaving
Anderson to Warner, 1 leg bye Warner gets a long way across and gets struck on the pad, large appeal from behind the bat, nothing from the bowler, probably too high. pitched just outside too
Anderson to Bailey, no run length and blocked around off stump
Anderson to Bailey, 2 runs a hint of width and carved to third man
Anderson to Bailey, no run length and left alone outside off
Anderson to Bailey, FOUR runs slightly short and pulled to the wide midwicket fence
Finn to Warner, 3 runs slightly short again and a short-arm pull through midwicket, that will make Warner feel better
Finn to Bailey, 1 run too straight and tucked behind square on the leg side
Finn to Warner, no run back of a length and cut to cover point
Finn to Warner, FOUR runs taken from the top of the bounce and smashed past cover, thumping stroke, a little bit of width is all Warner needs
Finn to Warner, 2 runs pulled down to long leg and they scramble back for two
Finn to Warner, FOUR runs another smashed four through the off side
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run starts back of a length and gets tucked into midwicket
Bresnan to Warner, 1 run tucked through square leg this time
Bresnan to Bailey, no run off stump and blocked back up the wicket
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 wide leg side wide
Bresnan to Bailey, no run full and left outside off
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run length and dropped in front of mid on

Bresnan to Warner, FOUR runs taken from only just back of a length outside off and heaved over mid on with a pull, didn't really seem to get hold of it either but it sails for a one bounce four, great shot
Broad to Bailey, no run length outside off and left
Broad to Bailey, no run pulled to midwicket
Broad to Bailey, no run length and left again outside off
Broad to Bailey, no run length and tighter on the off stump now, ran back to the bowler
Broad to Bailey, 1 run pulled out to deep square leg
Broad to Warner, no run short and flicked at and missed
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run short ball and hooked away, not in complete control and it was more top edge than middle but didn't carry to fine leg
Bresnan to Warner, FOUR runs another short ball and this one is dispatches much more effectively as Warner pulls it backward of square
Bresnan to Warner, no run full on middle and leg, defended towards mid-on
Bresnan to Warner, 1 run pulls again, this time in front of square and goes straight to Bopara in the deep
Bresnan to Bailey, no run outside off, defended to the off side back towards the bowler
Bresnan to Bailey, 1 run opens the face and guides comfortably down to third man
Swann to Bailey, 1 run full and worked down to long-on
Swann to Warner, 1 run nicely flight outside off and it's very sedately driven out to deep cover
Swann to Bailey, 1 run down to long-on
Swann to Warner, no run grips a little and takes a thick outside edge towards short third man
Swann to Warner, 1 run quicker and shorter, Warner onto the back foot and punches to deep cover
Swann to Bailey, no run worked into the leg side...tidy start from Swann
Broad to Warner, no run good start, full on middle and off, Warner defends from the crease
Broad to Warner, no run hint of movement back into Warner as he plays to the leg side
Broad to Warner, 1 run stays very straight to Warner and this time he's worked square on the leg side
Broad to Bailey, 2 runs short of a length, Bailey deep in his crease and flicks it between deep square and long leg
Broad to Bailey, no run full on off stump, defended towards mid-on
Broad to Bailey, no run up at Bailey's toes and it's flicked firmly to mid-on which means no chance of a single
Swann to Warner, no run dragged down short, cut away firmly but well fielded by Cook at cover
Swann to Warner, no run defended from middle stump into the off side
Swann to Warner, no run nice bowling, tossed up enticingly and gets a thick outside edge as he drives
Swann to Warner, no run goes back and is taken on the pads by a straighter ball (or one that doesn't turn) but it's going well down leg
Swann to Warner, no run full and pushed back to Swann...lovely contest brewing
Swann to Warner, 1 run goes back and works this into midwicket so he'll keep the strike
Broad to Warner, no run full and thumping powerfully towards mid-off, it pitches just short so makes it quite a tricky stop for Trott
Broad to Warner, SIX runs that's big, dropped in short by Broad and Warner's eyes light up as he pulls it over the deep midwicket boundary
Broad to Warner, no run back fuller on off stump, defended square into the off side
Broad to Warner, no run driven with an open face and but Bopara is in the way at backward point
Broad to Warner, 1 run that could have been nasty...Bopara nearly gets one in the face which bounces in the footmarks of the other wickets
Broad to Bailey, no run good line to finish with, on off stump and defended back to Broad
Swann to Warner, no run pushed into the off side
Swann to Warner, 1 run comes forward and opens the face to find the gap out to deep cover
Swann to Bailey, 1 run worked with the spin to square leg, good work from Anderson
Swann to Warner, 1 run full outside off, driven firmly square through the off side
Swann to Bailey, no run defended off the back foot
Swann to Bailey, no run flicked along the ground to midwicket
Bopara to Warner, 1 run hint of width first up, driven away square and there's a fumble at backward point by Morgan
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run shapes back into Bailey who plays it late to third man
Bopara to Warner, 1 run short of a length, whipped away off the stumps to deep square
Bopara to Bailey, 1 run opens the face and sends this fine of backward point...comfortably milking Bopara's first over
Bopara to Warner, no run good work by Bell at midwicket, Warner turned it off the stumps and was keen for the single before having hurry back
Bopara to Warner, 1 leg bye takes the pad down the leg side, it rebounds off Kieswetter's gloves towards short fine-leg
Broad to Warner, no run back of a length, punched firmly off the back foot to point
Broad to Warner, FOUR runs playing away from his body, gets an edge but pretty well controlled and beats third man
Broad to Warner, no run fuller on off stump, pushed square on the off side
Broad to Warner, 1 run opens the face and pushes through the covers to the sweeper and that's his fifty from 57 balls
Broad to Bailey, FOUR runs that's hammered, just a hint of width from Broad and it's cut powerful square through the off side
Broad to Bailey, 1 run responds with a short ball that Bailey doesn't play very well. Takes his eye off the ball as he pulls but it lobs safely through square leg
Anderson to Bailey, 1 run short of a length, worked off the back foot through midwicket
Anderson to Warner, 1 run tight! Pushed into the off side and Warner set off straight away but the throw goes to Bailey's end and strikes him on the back of the leg
Anderson to Bailey, no run aims for the gap in the leg side but gets it too straight to mid-on
Anderson to Bailey, FOUR runs wrong line, on leg stump and flicked backward of square...Australia picking up boundaries to keep themselves on track
Anderson to Bailey, no run dropped in short and Bailey cracks away the pull but straight to Bell at midwicket
Broad to Warner, 1 wide bouncer over and wide of leg stump...too wide for Aleem Dar's liking
Broad to Warner, 1 run outside off, guided down to third man to bring Michael Clarke onto strike
Broad to Clarke, no run big appeal! Clarke shoulders arms and it flicks the pad as it heads over middle and leg. Blimey that was close. Trusted the bounce
Broad to Clarke, no run good line, on off stump and Clarke defends to the off side
Broad to Clarke, no run full at Clarke, which is good early in his innings, and played down to long-on
Broad to Clarke, no run outside off and a more comfortable leave this time
Broad to Clarke, no run full on off stump, punched firmly back to the bowler. A good, testing over.
Anderson to Warner, FOUR runs short and pulled into the ground, he rode it well, the ball scudding to the square-leg rope

Anderson to Warner, OUT edged and that's a fantastic snag behind the stumps! Anderson pitched it up, having pushed Warner back, enticed him to drive and a thick edge flew towards first slip (which was vacant), meaning Kieswetter had to launch himself horizontally to grasp t
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run length ball, bit of width and cut through point to get Hussey off the mark straight away
Anderson to Clarke, FOUR runs overpitched outside off, Clarke drives elegantly down the ground for his first runs too
Anderson to Clarke, no run length delivery, steps out and leaves
Anderson to Clarke, FOUR runs drifts on to the pads and clipped fine, Bresnan gives chase but can't quite cut it off
Broad to Hussey, no run length ball outside off, Hussey stays back and offers no stroke
Broad to Hussey, no run touch short, defended towards point on the back foot
Broad to Hussey, 2 runs bouncer, pulled in front of square, didn't get fully on top of it but it landed safe before being pulled in around deep midwicket
Broad to Hussey, no run back of a good length, knocked to extra-cover on the back foot
Broad to Hussey, no run length ball, played on the front foot towards mid-off
Broad to Hussey, no run effort ball from Broad, touch of away swing, Hussey leaves
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run length ball, on the stumps, nudged into the leg side
Anderson to Hussey, 1 run touch short, steered down to third man
Anderson to Clarke, no run back of a length, Clarke comes forward and defends to cover
Anderson to Clarke, 2 runs full and tailing in, driven hard past extra-cover, Cook gallops across from mid-off and just about pulls it in
Anderson to Clarke, no run length ball in the corridor, dabbed towards point, they think about one but Clarke elects against it
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run on the pads, clipped into the leg side
Finn to Clarke, no run signs of menace again, back of a length, Clarke dangles his bat at it and is beaten outside off
Finn to Clarke, 1 run darting in towards off, worked through midwicket off a good length
Finn to Hussey, no run touch short, played back down the pitch from the crease
Finn to Hussey, no run short of a length, straightens on off, Hussey prods tentatively as the ball fizzes past the edge and over the stumps
Finn to Hussey, 1 run fuller, tucked off the legs towards mid-on
Finn to Clarke, 1 wide wild delivery, veering away down the leg side as Finn loses control slightly
Finn to Clarke, no run pitched up outside off, classical cover drive but fielded comfortably
Bresnan to Hussey, no run pitched up on the stumps, driven into the on side
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run bit of width and cut through point off a good length
Bresnan to Clarke, no run full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
Bresnan to Clarke, no run length delivery, played towards cover
Bresnan to Clarke, no run banged in, angling back towards the top of off, Clarke defends into the off side
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run touch short, on the body and worked square on the leg side

Finn to Clarke, 1 run full pitched and ducking back in late in the day, Clarke drives and gets an inside edge on to his front pad, the ball deflecting away and they grab one, despite an attempt at the stumps
Finn to Hussey, no run good length outside off, Hussey goes back and leaves
Finn to Hussey, 1 run short, pushed towards mid-on, this could be tight but Cook misses with his throw at the non-striker's end
Finn to Clarke, no run pushed into the off side on the back foot
Finn to Clarke, no run fullish length, on the stumps, solid forward defensive
Finn to Clarke, no run back of a length, rising up at the batsman, who goes back and across to block
Bresnan to Hussey, FOUR runs length ball, goes back and cuts fine, possibly a thick edge, but there's no slip and the ball skedaddles away for four
Bresnan to Hussey, no run length ball on off stump, pushed into the off side
Bresnan to Hussey, no run bit of width, stays back and cuts hard, straight to point
Bresnan to Hussey, no run pushed through on a good length outside off stump, no stroke
Bresnan to Hussey, no run back of a length, rolls his fingers over the ball, pushed defensively towards cover
Bresnan to Hussey, no run fuller length, shapes away from the batsman as Hussey tries to cart the ball over the infield, missing everything and bringing a chorus of 'ooohs' from the crowd
Swann to Clarke, no run tossed up outside off, punched to mid-on
Swann to Clarke, no run dragged a bit shorter as Clarke leaves his crease, defended on the front foot
Swann to Clarke, 1 run flighted on off, steps out and sweeps through square, there's a misfield but the man in the deep covers it
Swann to Hussey, no run tossed up, comes forward and knocks back down the pitch
Swann to Hussey, no run flighted on off, worked square on the leg side
Swann to Hussey, 1 run full and on the stumps, driven to long-on
Bresnan to Hussey, no run back of a length, on the stumps, blocked short on the off side
Bresnan to Hussey, no run length ball, angled in towards middle and leg, shovelled to midwicket
Bresnan to Hussey, no run tight line, worked towards point from in front of off - another dot
Bresnan to Hussey, 1 run touch short, prodded towards cover where Bopara collects and attempts a back-of-the-hand shy at the striker's end
Bresnan to Clarke, no run outside the line of off, coming back a touch, Clarke plays it on the walk to midwicket
Bresnan to Clarke, no run sliding down leg, flicks the pad and Kieswetter takes the catch

Finn to Hussey, OUT bumper, Hussey gets in a tangle, the ball hits him on the helmet ... and drops on to the stumps! Strange dismissal, that, Hussey mistimed his pull completely, was hit on the shoudler, then the helmet, the ball finally plopping on to the wicket
Finn to Smith, no run defended in front of off stump
Finn to Smith, no run pitched up a tad more, played towards point
Finn to Smith, no run back of a length, angling in, defended on the back foot
Finn to Smith, 2 runs touch short, pitches and holds its line, Smith plays away from his body and the ball dies before reaching Anderson at second slip, who deflects it past Cook at first
Finn to Smith, 2 runs short of a length outside off, chopped behind point for a couple

Bresnan to Clarke, no run full and Clarke mishits his drive straight back at Bresnan, who drops a dolly! The ball came off the toe of the bat, flew fairly tamely into Brezzie Lad's bread basket ... but he shells it
Bresnan to Clarke, FOUR runs drifts down leg and this is flicked behind square for a galling/restorative four
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run bit of width, swings hard and a thick outside edge flies down to third man
Bresnan to Smith, no run short of a length, Smith pulls into the ground on the leg side
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run chopped towards mid-on, another tight call is successful, though Smith is hit on the chin byt the throw - he's all right
Bresnan to Clarke, no run length ball outside off, pushed square on the off side
Finn to Smith, 1 run on the stumps, worked into the leg side
Finn to Clarke, 1 run short of a length, dragged down through point
Finn to Smith, no run Smith has a big roundhouse swing at a bouncer, which fairly cuts him in half
Finn to Smith, no run full and outside off, driven to cover
Finn to Smith, 1 run touch short, angling down leg, turned off the pads into a gap in front of midwicket
Finn to Clarke, no run jaffer from Finn, back of a length, rising and holding its line ... too good even for Clarke
Bresnan to Smith, 1 run length ball, tailing in towards middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
Bresnan to Clarke, no run touch short outside off, chopped towards point
Bresnan to Clarke, no run length, veering down leg, Clarke wanders a long way across and misses with a glance ... Bresnan appeals for the wicket, Clarke wants a wide
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 run short and wide, dabbed through point for a single to the sweeper

Bresnan to Smith, OUT length ball, in the corridor and Smith fences weakly at it, nicking through to the keeper! That won't convince the doubters, pushing away from his body, perhaps trying to guide the ball to third man ... but failing
Bresnan to Wade, 1 run on the legs, flicked off the hips for one behind square
Swann to Wade, no run off stump and blocked back up the wicket
Swann to Wade, 1 run pushed out through cover from a length
Swann to Clarke, no run played awkwardly, a little leading edge back towards Swann
Swann to Clarke, 1 run big stride and turned with the spin through midwicket
Swann to Wade, no run down the wicket gets struck on the pad, appeal for lbw, there's a conference and no referral, rightly so I think
Swann to Wade, no run another step down and a push to cover
Broad to Clarke, no run back of a length and cut to point for a crowd catch
Broad to Clarke, 1 run full and driven down to long off
Broad to Wade, no run full, outside off and left alone
Broad to Wade, no run left again outside off stump
Broad to Wade, no run square driven to point who saves well
Broad to Wade, 1 run played forward to cover, they refuse the second on the misfield, good call
Swann to Wade, 1 run down the track and driving to extra cover who parries and they take a run
Swann to Clarke, 1 run swept out to deep backward square leg
Swann to Wade, 1 run fiddled to a vacant square leg area
Swann to Clarke, no run step away and a cut to cover
Swann to Clarke, 1 run flatter ball moved through midwicket but only a single again
Swann to Wade, no run down the track but just blocked to cover
Broad to Clarke, FOUR runs ooo thin edge to fine third man for four, fortunate but four nevertheless, the type of fortune Australia need
Broad to Clarke, 1 run straight delivery nearly slips past the drive which goes to long on for a single
Broad to Wade, no run back foot push to mid on from a length around off stump
Broad to Wade, 1 run square drive out to deep cover
Broad to Clarke, 1 run good looking drive down to long off
Broad to Wade, 1 run pulled to deep square leg
Swann to Wade, FOUR runs swept hard and placed very well, went very square and gets four between the two deep men, good shot
Swann to Wade, no run down the track, not to the wicket and almost gets beaten past the outside edge, nudges it to the 45 in the end
Swann to Wade, no run length ball turned into midwicket
Swann to Wade, 2 runs heaved down the ground, nowhere near the pitch of the ball, dragged towards and short of long on, fortunate there Wade
Swann to Wade, 3 runs turned very fine and a diving save saves a run, jolly good work from Anderson
Swann to Clarke, 1 run taken from off stump out to deep square leg
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run full and dug out through midwicket
Anderson to Wade, 1 run pulled to deep midwicket
Anderson to Clarke, 3 runs full and flicked out into the leg side wide of deep midwicket
Anderson to Wade, no run better on off stump and blocked back to the bowler
Anderson to Wade, 1 run cut hard through point, a wild return from Swann but does enough to save the single
Anderson to Clarke, no run Clarke came down the wicket but Anderson dropped it in a touch short forcing Clarke to adjust and just block to cover
Swann to Wade, 1 run stepped back to a full ball and pushed through point, dangerous
Swann to Clarke, 1 run swept aerially and fielded well on the square boundary
Swann to Wade, no run down the track but fired in and just blocked to cover
Swann to Wade, no run went for this, down the pitch and the kitchen sink is chucked at this, no idea where it was and it falls at Wade's feet, he scrambles back into his ground
Swann to Wade, no run tried to come down again, a little bit of turn and Wade just blocks once more
Swann to Wade, 1 run another step away and cut through point
Anderson to Wade, SIX runs bang! Picked up off a length into the Mound stand, amazing strike, that was big
Anderson to Wade, no run driven to mid off
Anderson to Wade, 1 run length and nudged through cover, they try for two but not on
Anderson to Clarke, 2 runs leading edge down to long off, so weakly did it travel that they come back for two
Anderson to Clarke, no run turned to midwicket
Anderson to Clarke, 1 leg bye length, off the pad to backwards square leg
Swann to Clarke, FOUR runs slightly short and cut in front of square for four, great shot
Swann to Clarke, no run blocked back up the wicket
Swann to Clarke, SIX runs shot! Massive strike into the Tavern stand, picked up from outside off and timed superbly into the crowd
Swann to Clarke, 1 run swept hard out to deep square leg

Swann to Wade, OUT played into the leg side, oh and there's a huge mix up and Wade is run out! Clarke wanted the run, Wade did not but eventually had to go to save his skipper and was easily run out at the non-striker's end, disaster for Australia
Swann to Clarke, 1 run turned through square leg
Bresnan to Clarke, no run length and pushed to midwicket
Bresnan to Clarke, 1 wide slower ball and a leg side wide
Bresnan to Clarke, 2 runs back of a length and chipped over midwicket, long on goes round
Bresnan to Clarke, FOUR runs stepped across the stumps and turned around the corner, no-one at backward square and that's four more

Bresnan to Clarke, no run full ball strikes the pad, a huge appeal, surely going down, given not out but they review it, I thought it was going down, hitting in line with leg stump but indeed, going a mile down
Bresnan to Clarke, 2 runs back of a length and taken behind square leg again, two this time

Bresnan to Clarke, OUT got him this time! A similar delivery to earlier in the over but this is much straight and up goes the finger! Bang in front this is, he swings across it and caught plumb in front, game over now is it?
Finn to Lee, no run forward onto off stump and blocked
Finn to Lee, FOUR runs short ball and Lee ducks, it comes off a top edge and flies over the keeper, the periscope Bumble's called it, left his bat up when he ducked and got a top edge for four!
Finn to Lee, 1 run pushed into midwicket
Finn to McKay, no run fine back of a length nip-awayer that McKay gets nowhere near
Finn to McKay, 1 run push from middle and leg wide of mid on
Finn to Lee, no run another fine delivery slides past the outside edge as Lee just plodded forward
Bresnan to McKay, no run back of a length, tried to be turned to midwicket, comes off pad and bat to cover
Bresnan to McKay, no run fuller and McKay pushes at it and misses
Bresnan to McKay, 1 run taken off leg stump out to deep square leg
Bresnan to Lee, no run middle and leg, ran back up the wicket
Bresnan to Lee, FOUR runs four over midwicket, a clean strike, one bounce into the grandstand
Bresnan to Lee, 1 wide and now a slower ball wide
Bresnan to Lee, no run much better, not length and allowing Lee to swing his arms, back of a length and he misses with a cut on off stump

Broad to McKay, OUT down the pitch, straight up and caught by Kieswetter. McKay went for a leg side heave to a back of a length ball that he tried to step down the track to but it just went up and the keeper went to his left to take it with both hands easily
Broad to Lee, 1 run edged cut to third man
Broad to Cummins, no run length and just ran to point
Broad to Cummins, FOUR runs back of a length and a good shot over short midwicket with a short arm lift and gets it wide of deep midwicket to the rope
Broad to Cummins, no run beauty, wobbles away off the seam as Cummins just pushed at it into the off side

Broad to Cummins, OUT gone! It looked stone dead, missed a full ball that beat the inside edge, he refers it but this is just out and indeed Hawk Eye confirms as such, that was a ridiculous referral! Right in front on the back pad, if that ain't out, nowt is
Bresnan to Lee, 2 runs pushed to midwicket and they take a couple as the boundary fielders can't get in quickly enough
Bresnan to Lee, FOUR runs step away and hammered over extra cover, a lovely strike, smashed to the rope, nearly went all the way, fine shot
Bresnan to Lee, no run Lee steps away, Bresnan follows him and it's, not a wide! Eh!? Must have hit the pad, it was jolly well taken by Kieswetter too
Bresnan to Lee, 1 run slapped down to long on
Bresnan to Doherty, no run pushed at outside off and missed
Bresnan to Doherty, 1 run full toss, ran into the covers and they take a single
Swann to Doherty, no run back of a length and an thin edge put down by the keeper, tough tough chance
Swann to Doherty, no run swept off off stump to the 45
Swann to Doherty, 1 run ran out through point on a length
Swann to Lee, FOUR runs fired in and it comes off the a very fine bat and runs away for four past the 45
Swann to Lee, 1 run length and pushed down the ground to long on
Swann to Doherty, no run blocked on off stump
Broad to Lee, 1 run back of a length, tucked to backward square leg and that should win the game with Douherty on strike
Broad to Doherty, 1 run slapped down the ground to long off
Broad to Lee, 3 runs a heave towards the leg side goes straight through Steve Finn on the 45, they take three out to the long leg boundary, Finn does well to save second time around
Broad to Doherty, 1 wide wide outside off and that's a wide
Broad to Doherty, no run off stump and blocked into cover
Broad to Doherty, 1 run outside off, slapped off an inside edge just wide of the bowler
Broad to Lee, no run Broad follows Lee's shuffle to leg and gets it through his legs
Finn to Doherty, 1 run steps to leg, gets hit on the body, they charge a run, Finn can't hit the bowler's end stump so they take a run
Finn to Lee, 1 run length ball drilled down the ground
Finn to Doherty, 1 run inside edge behind square on the leg side to a length ball
Finn to Lee, no run length ball, a heave and a miss and England have all but won
Finn to Lee, 2 runs slapped into the off side the come back for two
Finn to Lee, no run another huge swing and a miss

So England win by 15 runs and beat Australia at Lord's for the first time since 1997. Eoin Morgan's innings setting up a solid total that they have defended comfortably in the end...Still four games to come in this series starting on Sunday at The Oval, join us then for all the be
England won by 15 runs
Player of the match is Eoin Morgan, ENG
